NDACompanyRestrict.text: This is the restrictions of disclosure placed on the COMPANY by the Supplier so the SOW 'ideas' cannot be shared

NDASupplierRestrict.text: This is the restriction of disclosure placed on the SUPPLIER by the Company so the SOW 'ideas' cannot be shared

AdherencetoLaws.text: Clause that says both companies will follow laws and regulations

IntellectualCapital.text: Any clauses describing Intellectual Capital Protections or assumptions

Compliance.text: Onboarding, property agreement that either party must COMPLY to

GoverningContract.text: Clauses that say which contract can govern over another. This classification also includes Master Services Agreement that reference a larger agreement saying the SOW is under that guidance

FPTerms.text: Explination of Fixed Price Payment Terms

PaymentTerms.text: Late payments, early payments, when payments are due, format of payments

CompanyActivities.text: These are the actions or activities the Company will 'do' under the agreement

CompanyRolesandResponsibilities.text: The Staffing the Company is to bring to the work

SupplierActivities.text: These are the actions or activities the supplier will 'do' under the agreement

SupplierRolesandResponsibilities.text: The Staffing the Supplier is to Bring to the work

SpecialTerms.text: Any terms specific to this engagement especially any specific clauses made by Supplier or Cisco as well as any termination terms

ExecutiveSummary.text: The first section, usually purpose or overview of the work

WorkingConstraint.text: This is an important section that limits the work activity by some type of numerical constraint.  Letting both parties understand the boundaries of the work.  No more than 20 Database tables will be built.

Assumptions.text: What are the assumptions around the work that set the boundaries

AcceptanceCriteria.text: Acceptance criteria vary according to type of deliverable or service. The Acceptance Criteria would normally include a delivery date and required quality levels of deliverables. Includes testing procedure that the deliverable must pass to be 'accepted'

Deliverable.text: These are the deliverables that should come out of the work

WorkSingatureRequirements.text: Specifies that the COMPANY accepts the payment conditions and the SUPPLIER agrees to complete the specified work & the contract is valid

ThirdPartyProperty.text: Clauses that  specify the usage of any third party property by SUPPLIER to complete the Work and SUPPLIER will be responsible for the payment

WorkProductSpecifications.text: specifies the technical, functional and other specifications of the work product

Service.text: These are the service offerings that should come out of the work

ServiceLevel.text: The service's desired performance levels that measure the quality, quantity, timing and acceptability of the services being provided.

SLATerms.text: Specifies how many SLAs to be included in order to meet the desired service level to be provided by the SUPPLIER

Monitoring.text: Describes how the performance levels are supervised and monitored

Report&Resolution.text: Specify the contact details to report the problem to and the order in which details about the issue have to be reported & how they will be resolved

Escalation.text: Specifies the procedudre on failing to meet SLA for a certain time frame specified by Supplier

Termination.text: Breach of contract and termination on continuous failure to meet SLA within time frame defined in corrective action plan

ChangeControl.text: This is a Scope Management Language

CRMayChangeFees.text: Ability to PCR if scope or assumptions change

CRAcceptance.text: Describes how acceptance of changes in scope will be handled
